title: Art Insights: Andy Warhol—From A to B and Back Again
title_display: Art Insights: Andy Warhol—From A to B and Back Again
hero_caption: Andy Warhol. Shot Orange Marilyn (detail), 1964. Private collection. © 2019 The Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Inc. / Artists Rights Society (ARS), New York.
description:
Art Insights provides a historical and enlightening art-enrichment experience for older members of the community who are unable to visit the Art Institute in person. The Art Institute is pleased to partner with Well Connected's Museums at Home series to provide virtual slideshows and telephone-based Art Insights conversations on a national scale. To participate in this program, you will need a telephone or a computer with internet access.

Join Art Institute volunteer presenter Dave Williams as we examine the iconic Pop artist Andy Warhol's life from his humble beginnings in Pittsburgh to fame in the heights of Manhattan.

This virtual presentation is hosted by Well Connected, a nonprofit community of adults 60+ who connect via phone- or computer-based conversations, lectures, classes, games, and much more.

To register, please call (877) 797-7299 or email coviaconnections@covia.org. For more information, please visit https://covia.org/services/well-connected/.
